page.title: 09BEECHWOOD FARM
page.content: BEECHWOOD FARM HAS HAD AS ITS TENANT FARMER FOR THE LAST 25 YEARS THE WATERHOUSE FAMILY. THE FARM IS 380 ACRES MADE UP AS FOLLOWS, WINTER BARLEY 150 ACRES,SPRING BARLEY 91 ACRES,SUGAR BEET 60 ACRES,POTATOES 33ACRES AND YOUNG PEAS 46 ACRES. MR WATERHOUSES TWO SONS CONTINUE TO WORK ON THE FARM. AGAIN MUCH CHANGE HAS COME ABOUT BY NEW FARMING METHODS ESPECIALLY WITH FERTILIZERS AND INSECTICIDES. THE HOUSE IS 112 YEARS OLD AND AT ONE TIME HAD A SHIP S BOILER THAT SAW TO ALL THE WATER REQUIREMENTS. THIS HAD TO BE PULLED DOWN DUE TO THE WALLS BUCKLING. IT HAS A GRAIN STORE WHICH HOLDS 549 TONS WHICH IS EIGHT FEET DEEP WHEN FULL.IRRIGATION IS FROM THE CHESTERFIELD CANAL AND IS PUMPED UNDER THE MAIN RETFORD WORKSOP ROAD.
